title: You can only have big burst if you also have good mobility
body:
Kat
Leblanc
Fizz
Nidalee
Zed
Kass
Edit: Lee Sin

R.I.P. Veigar (also Morde)

replies.body:
Notice though that Veigar's all point and click abilities. If he's in range he never misses. At least the others can be dodged, or the other player can miss.

Not to mention his R nerf is made up for by more farming on his Q. And his Q has longer range.
last I checked Kat has just as many point and click abilities.

I'm not saying veig was healthy but come on.

He isn't mobile, so he either ults front line bruiser, or he kills squish and dies for it.

The extra farm will not make up for lost ratio on R and his stun pretty much only useful in bronze where people don't pay attention to abilities, they just try to use their own.
Its 1.0 better every other mages stop complaining.

> [{quoted}](name=DanofDemacia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=38IuxOYo,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2015-02-14T20:58:44.881+0000)
>
> Its 1.0 better every other mages stop complaining.

actually malz has a 1.2 damage on his ult, but it is over 2 or so seconds

Don't forget Annie. Tibbers has a total AP ratio 9.8.

Though that's over.. like.. What? 20 seconds?
1.3, actually.
Fizz has 100 + a damage amplifier on a lower cooldown

His R will still lose damage though, lategame as veig you get roughly 1K ap (depending on build and q farm) You'd have to get +-150 extra ap from the q change to get it even in damage. His overall damage IF he hits everything might be higher, but that's overkill on any squishy anyway.
Will only be  Higher if he hits a second target with his Q, but the overall dmg on a single target will most likely go down.

Must say that the current changes they are proposing are not exactly intuitive. The Veigar changes would already be huge, but I really do feel bad for the Mordekaiser mains that remain. These changes are mostly nerfs, with a couple smaller buffs thrown in. Low range, no gap-closers, no mobility and little range. Now he's getting his burst potential nerfed aswell, so that they can call him a bruiser. I enjoyed playing a lot of Mordekaiser, but I don't main him. But for those that do (and I know that there're not a large amount of players who do), I hope that your favourite champion isn't ruined too much by these changes. Hopefully Riot will see these changes are not accomplishing anything healthy for the game or champion in general.

Mordekaiser main here, and I'm not really happy about these changes so far. It's actually pretty sad that they're changing a burst mage to a tank. What do all tanks have in common? CC... that's why you can't normally ignore them in fights. Mordekaiser can't excel at being a tank because he has no cc, and in his new changes, they LOWERED his damage even more. Without much damage or any CC whatsoever, there won't be any reason to really play him now. Hoping Riot takes a look at the feedback for Mordekaiser and makes some large adjustments.
put lee sin in that list too
I forgot, Morde is getting any burst he has taken away as well!

I don't really understand why people are so mad about Veigar getting nerfed, he's always kind of had a toxic kit. Two point and click nukes. Honestly, all he would need late game is just a Q + R to kill most champions. Also, his R has a pretty bad mechanic attached to it. He gets to scale off of his opponent... so if he's doing bad, and he feeds the enemy, he gets rewarded by being able to nuke them even harder. His stun was also problematic, because it was a huge, instant, AoE stun on a burst mage. Burst mages should not have that kind of CC.

I will say though, the delay on his E is too long. I think that 0.5 seconds would be much better, just like Cho'Gath's Q. Lowering the ratio on his R is also justified, as it already has an enormous base damage, and very high scaling on your AP, and then high scaling on your opponent's AP. 

500 + 120% AP + 80% opponent's AP is extremely high for a point and click. Lowering it by just 20% AP is completely fine.

I don't really like the Q being changed to a skillshot, however. It's his bread and butter skill, it needs to stay consistent. I don't mind having is Q targeted, as long as they change his R to a skillshot.

These are just my thoughts, and I know I'm going to get downvoted for stating my opinion on Veigar. I just think that adding a little more counterplay would be nice. Also, don't mention how "Zed can beat Veigar so well", this is not about Zed, it's about Veigar. Zed is a much bigger problem and has nothing to do with Veigar. Zed needs some changes too.

I'll go ahead and type a better comment than what Vahlen made.

Veigar since mobility creep came closer and closer has been losing out to the mobile assassin mids. He has barely seen any, if at all, a form of LCS play despite being as powerful as you say. The issue was that even though he was extremely bursty, the range of his abilties could put him in a very high-risk position, and his only CC being in the form of his E. You are quite unlikely to hit your W without stunning them, as the massive delay on it makes landing it so hard. His Q's short range limits that to either anyone diving him or farming for AP. The entire reason Veigar was still mostly viable was solely because he had the lockdown capabilities in his E. His ult does scale off the enemy's AP, and while that can easily 100 to 0, say, Lux, he can still be outranged by her unless he gets her in the edge of his E. I kind of like it, though, even if the damage is pretty bullshit. I like the idea of a non-assassin Anti-mage. It's a role that no one else in the game really seems to fulfill. The damage reduction on his R is quite satisfactory to me, but the delay on his E will just make him that much harder. Remember, only reason he really excels is due to his E + W + R + Q combo, and giving it a delay just gives extremely mobile champs the passage to avoid Veigar's only form of CC. Also, his passive sucks now. I don't recall what it was like before mana changes, but now it's pretty bad.

TL;DR - Passive pretty bad, Q is okay (even if I do like it point-and-click), W has way too long of a delay, E is of severe controversy and probably shouldn't have been given a delay, and I feel his R nerf is justified.

Again, these are my thoughts. I'm not a huge expert on Veigar, but this is how I feel about him as of now.

Thank you for actually giving me a thought out response, and not just insulting me. I think I've just had bad times against a lot of Veigar's because of his ult, mainly. I even remember getting a Penta kill as Viktor in ARAM not too long ago, and right after I got it, Veigar spawned, walked over to me when I had about 80% of my health, and pressed R to deal 2300 damage to me for an easy kill with one button. He was behind too... so I just have mixed feelings on him. I might also be biased because I always hate when people say that "so and so champion is bad because everyone has mobility". I play Mordekaiser mainly, so when I hear that this champ sucks because of mobility, I get mad, because not all champs have mobility. Maybe I just have to face the fact that Mordekaiser is the underpowered one, and not everyone else is just overpowered. Anyways, I can agree with what you said. I've played Veigar a few times so far, and I find that landing a W on someone once they get Merc treads is near impossible. I don't think they can lower the delay time unless they lower the damage though. 320 + 100% AP is quite a lot for an AoE ability. If anything, they should just keep Veigar how he is on live. I think he's perfectly fine without DFG. DFG was sort of the overkill item for him. He never really needed it to kill anyone, because he could simply DFG + R or DFG + Q to one shot a lot of champs or just take them out from half health.

See , thats a good line of thinking.
The thing is that Veigar has no other defensive mechanic than his E, and even tho its a really strong skill it has no dmg, long cd and its usefullness is compensated be the others short comings of his kit (the heavy delay on his W, Q-R range and high ult cd).
I do agree that the 80% enemy ap on his ult is kind of bs , and i was expecting it gone , but insted of doing that they lowered the Veigar ratio (so he is less rewarded for farming/getting items) and heavily nerfed his only defense mechanism.
And if u think his W should be nerfed if it were given more reliavility its ok , but that dmg and ratio will have to go somewhere else, else he will lose a lot of dmg , most mages todoy have 3 dmging skills , and if they dont the lack of dmg on such skill is compensate be dmg elsewhere (if u want to check , Viktor is a good example of this with a base dmg of 1075+2.33ap ratio {1080+2.8 is Veigar}  if u get everything and only 1 ult tick {it gets higher for each ult tick that u get}).
And if u complain about Veigars "high dmg ult" let me show u this:
Dragons Rage:  Physical damage: 200 / 400 / 600 (+ 200% bonus AD) (+airborne xD)

Buster Shot: Magic Damage: 300 / 400 / 500 (+ 100% AP) (guess the trade of a 1000range knowback is .2ap and the other ratio and she is an adc -.-')
 
Mega Inferno Bomb:  	Magic Damage: 250 / 375 / 500 (+ 90% AP)  (same base , HUGE AOE and 5300 range? ok)

Blade Waltz: Maximum single-target damage: 325 / 663 / 1001 (+ 234% bonus AD) (LOLZ)

Trueshot Barrage: Magic Damage: 350 / 500 / 650 (+ 100% Bonus AD) (+ 90% AP) (:D)
I almost never play Veigar, and I mained Zed for a long time. I find more frustrating playing against Zed than playing against Veigar.

I personally would call Veigar a very bad design that kinda worked out. I mean look at his stun. It looks and feels like it should box people in,  like Jarvans ultimate. Yet, that is exactly what you don't want to happen because you almost never gain any benefit from it. I am pretty sure stunning someone with it was never meant to be the main use. As you said:
>Burst mages should not have that kind of CC

and Riot seems to feel the same.

Then again, you have dark matter, that requires you to be able to stun someone to be able to hit it. It just doesn't make any sense. Additionally, now that Q gets changed into a skillshot it might require the stun as well to hit reliably. That is only speculation though.

I really hope Veigar changes won't turn out to be the next Cassiopeia rework. A half-assed attempt, that had good ideas but was left in a kinda fine but actually worse than before state, because not enough work and thought was put into it.

All that beeing said, i should point out that i don't really play Veigar. Most of the points I made are mostly theoretical.
The feed back you just gave is indicative of your lack of skill at this game. Don't type when you're lacking oxygen to the brain please.
Oh snap!

Well, I knew I would get responses like this. I don't see how I'm showing a lack of skill here either. I'm actually fine right now, but thanks for thinking about me :) 

I just don't think getting one shot by any champion is very fair, but that's my opinion.

And the worst part is that when a mobile champ bursts you, people label it an 'outplay' or 'high skill', but when someone does the exact same thing w/o mobility, it's suddenly bad design and bad balance...  because let's be real, we're not really seeing sustained damage anymore outside of the ADC - EVERYONE bursts.

Kass isn't that bursty after the nerfs, his base damages are utter shit, the only thing he has is his mobility and late game damage, I believe he's the least troublesome of the mobility champs especially cause his mobility is limited with mana
We still have velkoz, Annie, and Cassiopea to look forward to....  till they get nerfed for "dfg compensation" or "morello removal compensation" or something else that totally kills mages.
Annie got buffed, actually.  I don't even pretend to understand Riot anymore.

> [{quoted}](name=Direwolfiez,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=38IuxOYo,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-02-15T04:42:31.110+0000)
>
> Annie got buffed, actually.  I don't even pretend to understand Riot anymore.

Exactly.

She got buffed.

She gonna be the next best burst mage after the downfall of Xerath and Veig

Then they gotta nerf her because she is also pretty good against zed.

EDIT: though.. i have a hopeful spirit about annie honestly. In the past, whenever she became too strong they wouldn't just nerf her. They would buff her in fact.

I remember when annie support was as strong as morg support in season 4. But they didnt nerf her at all. They simply added a passive on her q that let her farm extremely well with it.

You're not allowed to have burst if you're low mobility

Because having a hard time reaching your target and being rewarded for it is bad

The burst damage archetype (largely assassins but there are others, like Annie) is ultimately toxic to this game.

Nobody enjoys going from 100% to dead before being able to react.  And its particularly egregious for champions without a mobility escape.

I don't care about 100 to 0 champs. At least annie doesnt do it for free. She has to flash or die, usually both.

Champs like zed, LB, lee sin, etc., get to kill 100-0 for free essentially. Annie is the only low mobility champ that can 100-0 as quick as zed, kat or LB.

please let me know in what world a lee sin is 100-0'ing you with out you being able to do anything? and if it's even possible, he's fed as fuck and built pure dmg and if anyone throws a cc on him he will explode. statements like this thoroughly convince me that you kids who whine about lee sin literally just have no clue how to play against him.

Fun fact:

CC affects **literally everyone**. That's not counterplay, that's just basic logic.

Also really hard to land CC when he won't stop moving.
Annie has enough counterplay since she her burst is really short-ranged, and she has no way to reach you unless she burns flash.

> [{quoted}](name=Serenity Now,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=38IuxOYo,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-02-14T21:24:56.676+0000)
>
> The burst damage archetype (largely assassins but there are others, like Annie) is ultimately toxic to this game.
> 
> Nobody enjoys going from 100% to dead before being able to react.  And its particularly egregious for champions without a mobility escape.

There will be always toxic champions. . Please stop this argument. It's bs. And are you okay with Malzahar's DPS damage? Because it's dps it deals more than any burst champion.

100-0 champions absolutely must have counterplay to their combo.  Veigar didn't, so he had to suck.

If this E nerf works, and people can sometimes avoid his 100-0, that is great news for Veigar fans.  Maybe not this patch, but counterplay to his combo means Riot can let him actually be good.
Yes he had counterplay. It's called stay out of range. You can't say the same for Zed, Kat, Akali or LB who all burst as hard while having mobility
The problem with the kinds of Zed is that they "have" counterplay in paper, but when you actually play the game you notice there is even less counterplay for a good Zed than for a good Veigar.

Add short range and set up time to that, ppl paying attention could try to go for Veigar when he landed a stun on an important target( i mean , unless u are one of those frontline adcs i have seen , that like to get in the face of the enemy team, but dont u worry , Veigar is and will be the least of ur problems), also , he needs like 1.25-1.5 secs to land his full combo after the target is stunned, and he has to do it from 650 range (cos they are skills is like 500-550 aa range) so , unless u are really playing like shit be being at the front of ur team , away from any peeler/bruiser (i mean , proper positioning) u shouldnt be having problems vs Veigar.
{{champion:161}} would like to have a word with you
Because fizz is so strong right now...
I'm still in disbelief about the 5 second garen ult that nidalee has. I'll never understand it

You don't need big burst if you don't die to it.{{champion:82}} 

Like seriously, it feels like Mordekaiser may be so ridiculously tanky next patch that his lack of mobility won't matter. AND he's getting a conditional movement speed boost, which does make him faster in some scenarios.
I don't get why he will be ridiculously tanky now. There is a post talking about numbers and tanky Mordekaiser will deal less damage and get less shield.

Any post that says he will get less shield is not taking account for him getting less shield the more magic resistance his targets have.

On live, the shield he gets is from the damage he deals. Since magic resistance will reduce the damage he deals, Mordekaiser will get less shields when his opponents have magic resistance.

The new Mordekaiser's shields are not based on that, and only based on his health, so the shield he gets from hitting the tanky front line is the exact same amount he gets from hitting the enemy carries, outside of hitting more or less targets.

This also doesn't take into account that Mordekaiser will be built tankier than current Morde to abuse the health ratios on the shield.

I just want to clarify {{champion:38}} damage in a vane try to stop people saying that "he's too OP" and that shit:
Q: 70/95/120/145/170 +0.7 AP
W: 40/65/90/115/140 +0.6 AP
E: 80/105/130/155/180 +0.7 AP
R: minimum: 80/100/120 +0.02 mana | maximum 240/300/360 +0.06% mana.
-And you have to spend 1,200 mana every time you want to deal that much damage.

Now let's compare him with a support not oriented to deal high damage like {{champion:267}} Nami is:
Q: 75/130/185/240/295 +0.5 AP
W: damage: 70/110/150/190/230 +0.5 AP | heal: 65/95/125/155/185 +0.3 AP
E: 75/120/165/210/255 +0.6 AP
R: 150/250/350 +0.6 AP
-Considering she landed all 3 basic attacks.

Even a support with nice CC like Nami outdamages him. What I wanna say is that Kassa actually pays for his insane mobility in form of reduced damage and limited burst. I think Kassa is a perfect example of a balanced mobility-based champion.

Now let's compare him with another assassin with similar mobility and similar role like {{champion:7}} LeBlanc is:
Q: 110/160/210/260/310 +0.8 AP
W: 85/125/165/205/245 +0.6 AP
E: 80/130/180/230/280 +1.0 AP
R: mimicking Q/E: 200/400/600 +1.3 AP | mimicking W: 150/300/450 +0.975 AP
-Considering she deals full damage from that ability.

I know that is pretty off-topic, but I just wanted to clarify why you can't really compare {{champion:38}} Kassadin to truly problematic champions. I actually think Kassadin is an example of healthy high-mobility champion.

duuurrrrrrrrr cuz most of them are assassins? thats their job? assassins are supposed to have good mobility and dmg for lack of cc and squishiness. On that list kassadin is the only one whos actually tanky but kass has always had problems anyway. Same as lee
Assassins are meant to make the game unplayable to every non-mobile champion in the game.
